result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard G Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:15 AM Defendant Richard G Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Richard G Allen.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds that waiver is done so knowingly and voluntarily.  Probable cause found.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  Information to be e-filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Motion to modify bond by court. Adj  for pleas.  Recess @ 11:22 AM 
Recalled 11:49 AM. Count 1 : Plea of guilty Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Court imposes 4 months in county jail - stayed.  12 months probation ordered.  Conditions of probation AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Any other counseling deemed appropriate by agents. Seek and maintain employment. Payment of court costs $443.00 includes DNA surcharge.  33 days credit in the event of revocation.

10:27 AM Defendant Richard G Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Richard G Allen.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense confirms receipt of complaint, waive formal reading.  Defense requests modification of bond due to treatment.  Bond modification to be filed and heard at preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
